page.title: 01SETTLE AND GIGGLESWICK
page.content: The town of {Settle}and the village of {Giggleswick}are in the middle of the 12 kilometre block. Both places appeared in the original Domesday Book. Most of the buildings date from the 17th.C. although much{new housing has been put up in the last 30 years. This is traditionally a{farming}area now wholly concerned with growing grass for sheep,dairy and beef cattle. Settle has become an important centre for the area providing for the needs of local people, and for those of the{visitors}who come into the area to enjoy the scenery.The{market}in Settle provides a local focus and an income for the town. The present threat to close the {Settle and Carlisle railway}has brought about much interest both nationally and internationally.
